subject_terms_3: East India Company Historic buildings Visual arts
physical_appearance: This print depicts the headquarters of the East India Company. The title of the print is located at the bottom centre, in capital letters. The print is bordered by a wooden frame, There are no visible tears or chips on the both the print and frame. There are images of human figures riding on horse carriages outside the main building. At the bottom left and bottom right of the print, the names of the artist and the engraver of this print are stated respectively. The colours on the print do not look smudged.
sgcool_label_text: East India House on Leadenhall Street was formerly Craven House, when it was acquired by the East India Company in 1648 for use as its headquarters in London. This print shows the East India House after remodelling and extension of its frontage was completed by the end of the 18th century. The engraving was based on a drawing by Thomas Hosmer Shepherd (1792-1864), an English topographical artist.
creator_1: Shepherd, Thomas H. (Thomas Hosmer) Tombleson, William, 1795 -
